alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 5:57PM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH HAS BEEN UPGRADED TO A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM SATURDAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations 2 to 4 inches west of US-395, little accumulation east of US-395, 4 to 8 between 8000 and 9000 feet, with up to 14 inches along the Sierra crest. Winds gusting up to 40 to 45 mph in lower communities and 75 to 80 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 1 AM Saturday to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Roads may become slick and blowing snow may cause lower visibility while driving. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
